intro: Plantaginorchis longicalcarata, commonly known as the long-beaked plantain orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring showy, lip-like petals and a distinctive, elongated spur that houses nectar. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, often in rocky or humus-rich soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting specific pollinators such as bees and wasps. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
